body.p: The amendments made in 2011 require an entity that accounts for its participation in a multi‑employer defined benefit plan as a defined contribution plan to disclose an indication of the level of its participation in the plan compared with other plan participants. Together with information about the whole plan, that disclosure provides information about the effect of any surplus or deficit on the amount, timing and uncertainty of an entity’s future cash flows.
